required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Bimatoprost 0.01% in the Clinical Setting

brief_summary.textblock: This is a study of bimatoprost 0.01% (LUMIGAN® 0.01%) in subjects with primary open-angle glaucoma (POAG) or ocular hypertension (OH) who require further treatment for elevated intraocular pressure (IOP).

primary_outcome.measure: Severity of Ocular Hyperemia in the Study Eye on a 5-Point Scale
primary_outcome.description: Hyperemia is the engorgement of the blood vessels (redness) of the eye. Hyperemia is graded in the study eye on a 5-point scale where 0=None (Normal), 0.5=Trace (Trace reddish pink with no more than slight perilimbal injection), 1=Mild (Mild flush reddish color), 2=Moderate (Bright red color), and 3=Severe (Deep, bright, diffuse redness). The numbers of patients in each severity grade are presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Intraocular Pressure (IOP) in the Study Eye
secondary_outcome.description: IOP is a measure of the fluid pressure inside the eye. A negative number change from baseline indicates a reduction in IOP (improvement) and a positive number change from baseline indicates an increase in IOP (worsening).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Who Discontinue Due to an Adverse Event
secondary_outcome.description: An adverse event is any untoward medical occurrence associated with the use of a drug, whether or not considered drug related.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Percent Change From Baseline in IOP
secondary_outcome.description: IOP is a measure of the fluid pressure inside the eye. A negative number change response indicates a reduction in IOP (improvement) and a positive number change response indicates an increase in IOP (worsening).

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pts with POAG or OH (Previously Treatment Naive)
arm_group.description: Previously treatment naïve patients with Primary Open-Angle Glaucoma (POAG) or Ocular Hypertension (OH) who require treatment with bimatoprost 0.01% (Lumigan® 0.01%).

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pts with POAG or OH (Switched Monotherapy)
arm_group.description: Patients previously on another monotherapy treatment with Primary Open-Angle Glaucoma (POAG) or Ocular Hypertension (OH) who require treatment with bimatoprost 0.01% (Lumigan® 0.01%).

intervention.description: One drop of bimatoprost 0.01% (Lumigan® 0.01%) in the affected eye(s) every evening for 12 weeks.
intervention.arm_group_label: Pts with POAG or OH (Previously Treatment Naive)
Pts with POAG or OH (Switched Monotherapy)

study_pop.textblock: Subjects with primary open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of primary open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension
- Determined by the treating physician to require treatment with bimatoprost 0.01%.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous use of Lumigan® 0.01%

group.title: Pts With POAG or OH (Previously Treatment Naive)
group.description: Previously treatment naïve patients with Primary Open-Angle Glaucoma (POAG) or Ocular Hypertension (OH) who require treatment with bimatoprost 0.01% (Lumigan® 0.01%).

group.description: Patients previously on another monotherapy treatment with Primary Open-Angle Glaucoma (POAG) or Ocular Hypertension (OH) who require treatment with bimatoprost 0.01% (Lumigan® 0.01%).

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Intraocular Pressure (IOP) in the Study Eye
outcome.description: IOP is a measure of the fluid pressure inside the eye. A negative number change from baseline indicates a reduction in IOP (improvement) and a positive number change from baseline indicates an increase in IOP (worsening).
outcome.population: Intent-to-Treat: Enrolled patients who received at least one dose of study medication and who were not currently treated with Bimatoprost 0.01% at the time of enrollment

reported_events.desc: The Safety Population is used to assess serious adverse events (SAEs) and adverse events (AEs) and included all enrolled patients who received at least one dose of study medication and who were not currently treated with Bimatoprost 0.01% at the time of enrollment (same as the intent-to-treat population)

group.title: Pts With POAG or OH (Previously Treatment Naive)
group.description: Previously treatment naïve patients with Primary Open-Angle Glaucoma (POAG) or Ocular Hypertension (OH) who require treatment with bimatoprost 0.01% (Lumigan® 0.01%).

group.description: Patients previously on another monotherapy treatment with Primary Open-Angle Glaucoma (POAG) or Ocular Hypertension (OH) who require treatment with bimatoprost 0.01% (Lumigan® 0.01%).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
